00455 
00456    // When sliding horizontally, the moving clip may automatically
00457    // snap to the beginning and ending of other clips, or to label
00458    // starts and stops.  When you start sliding, SlideSnapFromPoints
00459    // gets populated with the start and stop times of selected clips,
00460    // and SlideSnapToPoints gets populated with the start and stop times
00461    // of other clips.  In both cases, times that are within 3 pixels
00462    // of another at the same zoom level are eliminated; you can't snap
00463    // when there are two things arbitrarily close at that zoom level.
00464    wxBaseArrayDouble mSlideSnapFromPoints;
00465    wxBaseArrayDouble mSlideSnapToPoints;
00466    wxArrayInt mSlideSnapLinePixels;
00467 
00468    // The amount that clips are sliding horizontally; this allows
00469    // us to undo the slide and then slide it by another amount
00470    double mHSlideAmount;

00598 //This constant determines the size of the vertical region (in pixels) around
00599 //the bottom of a track that can be used for vertical track resizing.
00600 #define TRACK_RESIZE_REGION 5
00601 
00602 //This constant determines the size of the horizontal region (in pixels) around
00603 //the right and left selection bounds that can be used for horizontal selection adjusting
00604 #define SELECTION_RESIZE_REGION 3
